muchart 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

    Generate random samples from the gamma distribution

    r_g.Rd

    This function generates random samples from the gamma distribution.

    r_g(lots, n, mu, k, ...)

    Arguments

    lots

    The number of lots

    n

    The sample size

    mu

    The mean of the gamma distribution

    k

    The shape parameter of the gamma distribution

    ...

    Additional arguments to be passed to rgamma() from the stats package

    Value

    A matrix of random samples

    Examples

    r_g(lots = 5, n = 10, mu = 5, k = 2)
#>               n_1      n_2      n_3      n_4        n_5        n_6      n_7
#> sample_1 5.921988 2.231238 1.350923 0.931180  5.1874945 11.3203024 1.801298
#> sample_2 1.606415 8.539870 6.439052 3.836161 11.2490534  5.2258328 4.956818
#> sample_3 5.662759 2.173234 3.992083 5.949017  3.1595011  3.4961934 5.306813
#> sample_4 9.203781 2.788725 5.354133 4.520662  4.1327694  0.4801296 9.039902
#> sample_5 3.981442 3.926594 4.716995 4.239110  0.8315821 11.2035392 4.719152
#>                n_8       n_9       n_10
#> sample_1 1.9040319  1.594426  1.8553283
#> sample_2 5.4420522  5.686692 12.3938816
#> sample_3 0.8582654  3.873750  9.8123208
#> sample_4 4.9139840 12.915426  3.3238200
#> sample_5 1.9159287  9.191653  0.5963559
r_g(lots = 10, n = 20, mu = 10, k = 3)
